mn107:0.2: This training outlined here and all throughout the Nikāyas has to be followed in this order specifically in order to yield the intended result, in keeping with the simile of following directions to arrive at Rājagaha given below. This is because the defilements that each subsequent stage is meant to address will not have become apparent unless the previous ones have been consolidated. For instance, the understanding of what the five hindrances even are is necessarily warped in someone who hasn’t fulfilled the previous steps, and this is why the Buddha didn’t teach meditation to newcomers (not even [new monks](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an5.114)), but instead virtue, generosity, restraint, renunciation, and Right View, which was often enough to lead them to stream-entry.
